sentence.Network_en: The old lady could not read clearly without her monocle.
sentence.Network_cn: 这位婆婆若不戴上她的单片眼镜，便无法阅读。

sentence.Network_en: A cynic is a man who looks at the world with a monocle in mind's eye.
sentence.Network_cn: 好挖苦人的人,是在心目中戴上单片眼镜儿看世事的人.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 这叫“单片眼镜”（monocle），是早期的眼镜，最早出现在1720年代，19世纪盛行于欧美各国，一直沿用到20世纪中叶，是富裕阶级 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: from French (earlier in the sense 'one-eyed'), from late Latin monoculus 'one-eyed'

entry.def: A monocle is a glass lens which people wore in former times in front of one of their eyes to improve their ability to see with that eye.

means.word_mean: 1. lens for correcting defective vision in one eye; held in place by facial muscles
